intro: Omoea micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered omoea, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in moist, shaded environments within forests. The plant features opposite, elliptical leaves with smooth margins and a distinctive reddish or purple stem. Its small, clustered flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
